languageModelTools.name: devbuddy_get_ticket
languageModelTools.userDescription: Fetches detailed information about a specific ticket from Linear or Jira, including title, description, status, priority, assignee, and labels
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Use this tool when you need details about a specific ticket. Provide the ticket ID (e.g., 'ENG-123' or 'PROJ-456'). Returns comprehensive ticket information including title, description, current status, priority level, assigned user, and associated labels. IMPORTANT: The response includes 'devbuddyAction' (a command: URI) and 'devbuddyActionLabel' - you MUST format these as a clickable markdown link like this: [devbuddyActionLabel](devbuddyAction). For example: [Open in DevBuddy](command:devBuddy.openTicketById?...).

languageModelTools.name: devbuddy_list_my_tickets
languageModelTools.userDescription: Lists all active tickets assigned to the current user from Linear or Jira
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Use this tool to get a list of all tickets currently assigned to the user. Returns ticket IDs, titles, statuses, and priorities. Useful for answering questions like 'what am I working on?' or 'what are my tickets?'. No parameters required. IMPORTANT: Each ticket in the response includes 'devbuddyAction' and 'devbuddyActionLabel' - you MUST format these as clickable markdown links: [devbuddyActionLabel](devbuddyAction).

languageModelTools.name: devbuddy_get_current_ticket
languageModelTools.userDescription: Smart detection: finds your current work from branch name or In Progress tickets
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Use this tool to find out what the user is currently working on. Uses smart detection: (1) Analyzes the branch name to detect ticket identifiers (e.g., 'feat/eng-123-oauth' maps to 'ENG-123'). (2) If no ticket in branch name (e.g., on 'main'), falls back to tickets marked as 'In Progress' or 'Started'. Returns single ticket if found, multiple tickets with note if several are in progress, or helpful message if none found. No parameters required. IMPORTANT: The response includes 'devbuddyAction' and 'devbuddyActionLabel' - you MUST format these as clickable markdown links: [devbuddyActionLabel](devbuddyAction).

languageModelTools.name: devbuddy_create_ticket
languageModelTools.userDescription: AI-powered ticket creation with template support for Linear and Jira (Pro feature)
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Use this tool to create a new ticket/issue on Linear or Jira. This is a Pro feature. Provide ticket details like title (required), description, priority, assignee, project, team, and labels. The tool will create the ticket on the currently configured platform (Linear or Jira) and return the created ticket details with a clickable link. IMPORTANT: The response includes 'openInDevBuddy' - you MUST format it as a clickable markdown link.

description.description: Detailed description of the ticket (optional, supports markdown)

assigneeId.description: User ID to assign the ticket to. Use 'me' to assign to the current user. Optional.

projectId.description: Project ID or key to create the ticket in (optional)

teamId.description: Team ID for Linear (optional, uses default if not specified)

labels.description: Array of label names to add to the ticket (optional)

walkthroughs.title: Getting Started with DevBuddy
walkthroughs.description: Learn how to use DevBuddy to manage your tickets from Linear, Jira, and more‚Äîdirectly from VS Code

steps.title: Welcome to DevBuddy! üëã
steps.description:
DevBuddy brings multi-platform ticket management into VS Code. You can view tickets, update statuses, create branches, and more‚Äîall without leaving your editor.

**Supported Platforms:**
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Linear (full features)
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Jira Cloud (core features)
‚Ä¢ ‚è≥ More coming soon!

Let's get started!

steps.title: üìå Pin DevBuddy for Easy Access
steps.description:
For the best experience, pin DevBuddy to your Activity Bar!

**How to pin:**
1. Right-click the DevBuddy icon (checklist) in the Activity Bar
2. Select "Pin to Activity Bar"

**Why pin it?**
‚Ä¢ Quick access to your tickets
‚Ä¢ Visual reminders of your work
‚Ä¢ Seamless workflow

[Open DevBuddy Sidebar](command:workbench.view.extension.dev-buddy)

*You can skip this if DevBuddy is already pinned!*

steps.title: Choose Your Platform
steps.description: Select which platform you use for ticket management. You can change this anytime in settings!

steps.title: Connect Your Platform
steps.description: Now let's connect your ticket management platform! Choose the guided setup for your platform below.

steps.title: Explore Your Tickets
steps.description:
The **DevBuddy sidebar** shows all your assigned tickets/issues organized by status.

[Open DevBuddy Sidebar](command:workbench.view.extension.dev-buddy)

Click any ticket to see details, comments, and take actions like updating status or adding comments.

**Works with both Linear and Jira!**

steps.title: Update Ticket Status
steps.description:
Change ticket status without leaving VS Code:

‚Ä¢ Right-click any ticket/issue
‚Ä¢ Select **Update Status** or **Change Status**
‚Ä¢ Choose from your workflow states
‚Ä¢ See visual indicators for each status

**Works with both Linear and Jira!**

steps.title: Create New Tickets
steps.description:
Create tickets/issues directly from VS Code:

[Create New Ticket](command:devBuddy.createTicket)

**Linear:** Rich editor with all fields (team, project, labels, priority, estimates)

**Jira:** Create issues with project, type, priority, assignee, and more

**Works with both platforms!**

steps.title: Create Branches from Tickets (Linear)
steps.description:
**Linear users:** Start a branch directly from any ticket!

‚Ä¢ Click the branch icon next to any ticket
‚Ä¢ Choose your source branch
‚Ä¢ Review the auto-generated name
‚Ä¢ DevBuddy creates and checks out the branch

**Note:** Branch creation is currently Linear-only. Jira support coming soon!

steps.title: Convert TODOs to Tickets (Linear)
steps.description:
**Linear users:** Convert TODOs to tickets with automatic code permalinks!

**What you get:**
‚Ä¢ TODO ‚Üí Linear ticket in one click
‚Ä¢ Automatic GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket permalink
‚Ä¢ Code context (5 lines before/after)
‚Ä¢ Branch and commit info

[Try Converting a TODO](command:devBuddy.convertTodoToTicket)

**Note:** Currently Linear-only. Jira support coming soon!

steps.title: Generate Standup Updates (Linear)
steps.description:
**Linear users:** Let AI generate your standup update from commits and Linear activity!

[Open Standup Builder](command:devBuddy.openStandupBuilder)

‚Ä¢ AI analyzes your commits and tickets
‚Ä¢ Generates a summary in your preferred tone
‚Ä¢ Copy and share with your team

**Note:** AI features currently Linear-only. Jira support coming soon!

steps.title: AI-Powered PR Summaries (Linear)
steps.description:
**Linear users:** Generate comprehensive PR summaries for your changes:

[Generate PR Summary](command:devBuddy.generatePRSummary)

‚Ä¢ Detects affected packages in monorepos
‚Ä¢ Analyzes git changes and commits
‚Ä¢ Links to Linear tickets
‚Ä¢ Customizable writing tone

**Note:** AI features currently Linear-only. Jira support coming soon!

steps.title: Use the AI Chat Assistant
steps.description:
Talk to DevBuddy using the chat interface!

Open VS Code Chat and type `@devbuddy` to:

‚Ä¢ `/tickets` - See your current tickets
‚Ä¢ `/standup` - Generate standup update (Linear)
‚Ä¢ `/pr` - Generate PR summary (Linear)
‚Ä¢ `/status` - Update ticket status

Or just ask questions naturally!

**Works with both platforms, with enhanced features for Linear.**

steps.title: Jira-Specific Features
steps.description:
**Jira users** get these powerful features:

‚Ä¢ **JQL Search** - Search with Jira Query Language
‚Ä¢ **Workflow Transitions** - Full workflow support
‚Ä¢ **Sprints & Boards** - View and manage sprints
‚Ä¢ **Runtime Validation** - Production-grade API validation

**Coming soon:**
‚Ä¢ Branch integration
‚Ä¢ AI features
‚Ä¢ Webview panels
‚Ä¢ Custom fields UI

steps.title: Get Help Anytime
steps.description:
**Need help?** Click the **Help** button (question icon) at the top of the DevBuddy sidebar.

**Customize your experience:**
‚Ä¢ Open Settings (Cmd/Ctrl + ,)
‚Ä¢ Search for "DevBuddy"
‚Ä¢ Configure platform, AI model, writing tone, and more

[Open Settings](command:workbench.action.openSettings?%5B%22devBuddy%22%5D)

**Documentation:**
‚Ä¢ README.md - Main guide
‚Ä¢ FEATURE_COMPATIBILITY_MATRIX.md - Platform features
‚Ä¢ JIRA_QUICK_START.md - Jira setup

You're all set! üéâ

devBuddy.ai.disabled.markdownDescription:
**Completely disable AI features** and use rule-based summarization instead.

‚ö†Ô∏è **For sensitive organizations:** Enable this setting if you cannot use external AI services. The extension will use intelligent rule-based analysis instead.

**When to enable:**
- Working in a highly regulated environment
- Security policies prohibit external AI
- GitHub Copilot is not available

enumDescriptions: Automatically select the best available model
GitHub Copilot: GPT-4 Turbo (Fast and powerful)

devBuddy.ai.ticketCreation.enabled.markdownDescription:
**üíé Pro Feature:** Enable AI-powered ticket creation with natural language.

‚úÖ **When enabled:**
- Create tickets using conversational AI
- Auto-fill fields from your description
- Template support for Linear and Jira
- Smart validation and suggestions

‚ö†Ô∏è **Requires DevBuddy Pro license**

devBuddy.ai.ticketCreation.useTemplates.markdownDescription:
**üíé Pro Feature:** Use issue templates when creating tickets.

‚úÖ **When enabled:**
- Automatically applies platform templates
- Validates required fields
- Provides template-based suggestions

‚ö†Ô∏è **Requires DevBuddy Pro license**

devBuddy.ai.ticketCreation.confirmBefore.markdownDescription:
**üíé Pro Feature:** Require confirmation before creating tickets.

‚úÖ **When enabled:**
- Shows ticket preview before creation
- Allows editing before final submission
- Prevents accidental ticket creation

‚ö†Ô∏è **Requires DevBuddy Pro license**

devBuddy.debugMode.markdownDescription:
**Enable debug logging** for troubleshooting.

‚úÖ **When enabled:**
- Shows detailed logs in the "DevBuddy" Output channel
- Automatically opens the Output panel
- Logs all API calls, AI operations, and git commands

üí° **Use this when:**
- Reporting bugs or issues
- Understanding what the extension is doing
- Debugging AI summarization
- Troubleshooting platform API issues (Linear, Jira)

devBuddy.experimental.esmWebviews.markdownDescription:
**Experimental:** Enable ESM modules for webviews with code splitting.

‚ö° **Benefits:**
- ~77% smaller total bundle size
- Shared dependencies loaded once
- Faster subsequent webview loads

‚ö†Ô∏è **Note:** This is experimental. If webviews don't load properly, disable this setting.

devBuddy.telemetry.optOut.markdownDescription:
**Opt out of DevBuddy telemetry**

‚öôÔ∏è **How it works:**
- DevBuddy follows VS Code's global telemetry setting by default
- Enable this to opt out even if VS Code telemetry is enabled

üîí **Privacy:**
- 100% anonymous (no personal data)
- No code or file names tracked
- No content collection

üí° **What we collect when enabled:**
- Feature usage patterns
- Error types (not content)
- Performance metrics
- Extension version & platform

üìñ **Learn more:**
- [Telemetry Guide](https://github.com/angelo-hub/devbuddy#telemetry)
- [What data is collected](https://github.com/angelo-hub/devbuddy/blob/main/docs/features/telemetry/TELEMETRY_GUIDE.md)

devBuddy.multiRepo.enabled.markdownDescription:
**Enable multi-repository support**

‚úÖ **When enabled:**
- Track branch associations across multiple repositories
- Open tickets in their correct repository window
- Auto-discover related repositories in parent directory
- Show repository indicators in the sidebar

üí° **Use this when:**
- Working with microservices architecture
- Managing tickets across multiple repos
- Using a monorepo with separate ticket prefixes per package

devBuddy.multiRepo.autoDiscover.markdownDescription:
**Auto-discover related repositories** in parent directory

‚úÖ **When enabled:**
- Scans parent directory for other git repositories
- Extracts ticket prefixes from existing branches
- Suggests repository associations for tickets

‚ö†Ô∏è **Requires:** `devBuddy.multiRepo.enabled` to be true

devBuddy.multiRepo.parentDir.markdownDescription:
**Parent directory** containing related repositories

üí° **Examples:**
- `/Users/dev/projects` - Absolute path
- `..` - Relative to current workspace

‚ö†Ô∏è If empty, uses the parent of the current workspace
